data.title: Richard Rodgers Obituary - Oak Harbor, Washington
data.meta_description: Wallin-Stucky  Funeral Home n opened November 8, 2010 to serve the residents of Whidbey Island and beyond. Our new, state of the art facility is located at 1811 NE 16th Ave, Oak Harbor, WA. In January 2018, to serve our south end families, we opened a branch in Freeland, WA.
data.text:
IN MEMORY OF

RICHARD JAMES RODGERS

DECEMBER 14, 1977 – NOVEMBER 22, 2010

MEMORIAL SERVICE ON DECEMBER 4, 2010 AT 5:00 PM

It is with great sadness to report that Brother Richard Rodgers was called by the Supreme Grand Master on November 22, 2010.

Richard was born December 14, 1977, in Oak Harbor, WA to Pete and Dixie Rodgers. He attended Oak Harbor High School and later Western Business College. After school, he promptly began his career in Information Technology, culminating in his position as a Deployment Engineer at Microsoft. On April 19, 2008 he was wed to the love of his life, Gretchen Engel, in Seattle, WA. Richard was a loving husband and son, and a great friend to anyone who had the privilege of making his acquaintance. He loved to travel the world, for both business and pleasure, making friends around the globe. He was constantly driving himself and those around him to succeed in their personal lives and careers and was truly an inspiration to all who knew him.

He petitioned to Daylight Lodge No. 232 on March 17, 2007, and was Raised as a Master Mason on February 2, 2008. At the time of his passing, he served as Junior Warden of University Lodge No. 141. Brother Rodgers received his Royal Arch Degree in Oriental (Daylight) Chapter No. 19 on March 6, 2010.

The Masonic memorial funeral service will be conducted by Worshipful Brother Anthony Monaco of University Lodge No. 141 and Worshipful Brother Franklin Donahoe of Daylight Lodge No. 232.

Inurnment took place at Maple Leaf Cemetery on Tuesday, December 7 at 1:00 pm, where Richard was buried beside his brother Matthew and grandmother Helen.

“Forever Young"
